thread.title: Many of the world’s biggest websites are down thanks to Amazon outage | Metro News
thread.title_full: Many of the world’s biggest websites are down thanks to Amazon outage | Metro News

author: Rob Waugh For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Many of the world’s biggest websites are down thanks to Amazon outage | Metro News
text:
Rob Waugh for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 28 Feb 2017 7:20 pm Getty 
If you’re finding it a bit harder to waste time on the internet this evening, you’re not alone – a lot of the biggest sites just plain aren’t working. Sir Philip Green pays £363,000,000 of his own money to rescue BHS pensions 
Trello, Imgur, Medium, Soundcloud, Giphy and others are all either down or struggling – and it’s thanks to a breakdown at Amazon Web Services, which underpins the sites. 
The Register reports that a failure at an AWS facility in Virginia, America has left services falling offline from around 6pm UK time today. 
Ironically, the site IsItDownToday.com is, itself, down. 
Amazon is insisting that it isn’t an outage, but instead, ‘increased error rates’. AWS S3 Down, Heroku Down #Panic pic.twitter.com/NzImwPxMH8 
— Jose Augusto Montiel (@JoseMontielU) February 28, 2017 #s3 #down #aws the world must be ending. Oh the irony https://t.co/LcORJ3TkTm is also down. pic.twitter.com/MAaE0h9Gaj 
Amazon says, ‘We’ve identified the issue as high error rates with S3 in US-EAST-1, which is also impacting applications and services dependent on S3. We are actively working on remediating the issue.’ More
